t: Lamentations 4
The Holy Stones Lie Scattered
How*pn the gold has grown dim, how*ld the pure gold is changed! The*ln holy stones lie scattered at*ld the head of every street.
The*pn precious sons of Zion, worth*ld their weight in fine gold, how*ln they are regarded as earthen pots, the*ld work of a potter’s hands!
Even*pn jackals offer the breast; they*ld nurse their young; but*ln the daughter of my people has become cruel, like*ld the ostriches in the wilderness.
The*pn tongue of the nursing infant sticks to*ld the roof of its mouth for thirst; the*ln children beg for food, but*ld no one gives to them.
Those*pn who once feasted on delicacies perish*ld in the streets; those*ln who were brought up in purple embrace*ld ash heaps.
For*pn the chastisement of the daughter of my people has been greater than*ld the punishment of Sodom, which*ln was overthrown in a moment, and*ld no hands were wrung for her.
Her*pn princes were purer than snow, whiter*ld than milk; their*ln bodies were more ruddy than coral, the*ld beauty of their form was like sapphire.
Now*pn their face is blacker than soot; they*ld are not recognized in the streets; their*ln skin has shriveled on their bones; it*ld has become as dry as wood.
Happier*pn were the victims of the sword than*ld the victims of hunger, who*ln wasted away, pierced by*ld lack of the fruits of the field.
The*pn hands of compassionate women have*ld boiled their own children; they*ln became their food during*ld the destruction of the daughter of my people.
The*pn Lord*s gave full vent to his wrath; he*ld poured out his hot anger, and*ln he kindled a fire in Zion that*ld consumed its foundations.
The*pn kings of the earth did not believe, nor*ld any of the inhabitants of the world, that*ln foe or enemy could enter the*ld gates of Jerusalem.
This*pn was for the sins of her prophets and*ld the iniquities of her priests, who*ln shed in the midst of her the*ld blood of the righteous.
They*pn wandered, blind, through the streets; they*ld were so defiled with blood that*ln no one was able to touch their*ld garments.
“Away!*pn Unclean!” people cried at them. “Away!*ld Away! Do not touch!” So*ln they became fugitives and wanderers; people*ld said among the nations, “They*ld shall stay with us no longer.”
The*pn Lord*s himself has scattered them; he*ld will regard them no more; no*ln honor was shown to the priests, no*ld favor to the elders.
Our*pn eyes failed, ever watching vainly*ld for help; in*ln our watching we watched for*ld a nation which could not save.
They*pn dogged our steps so*ld that we could not walk in our streets; our*ln end drew near; our days were numbered, for*ld our end had come.
Our*pn pursuers were swifter than*ld the eagles in the heavens; they*ln chased us on the mountains; they*ld lay in wait for us in the wilderness.
The*pn breath of our nostrils, the Lord’s*s anointed, was*ld captured in their pits, of*ln whom we said, “Under his shadow we*ld shall live among the nations.”
Rejoice*pn and be glad, O daughter of Edom, you*ld who dwell in the land of Uz; but*ln to you also the cup shall pass; you*ld shall become drunk and strip yourself bare.

The*pn punishment of your iniquity, O daughter of Zion, is accomplished; he*ld will keep you in exile no longer; but*ln your iniquity, O daughter of Edom, he will punish; he*ld will uncover your sins.
